body:
Hey, 
I am not able to reproduce this error, could you please provide some addition details.
Thanks!

rename.from: [BUG] INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR when sorting the runs table by a merrics
rename.to: [BUG] INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR when sorting the runs table by metric or by date

body: I've updated the version to v1.7.2 and the bug is still there.

Hey,
Are you using an SQL server?

That is where this issue is most likely coming from. Quoting the docs : https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/tracking.html#where-runs-are-recorded
"MLflow supports the dialects mysql, mssql, sqlite, and postgresql."

@arjundc-db
However, according to your quote, MLflow supports SQL server dialect = mssql.

That is where this issue is most likely coming from. Quoting the docs : https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/tracking.html#where-runs-are-recorded
"MLflow supports the dialects mysql, mssql, sqlite, and postgresql."

Is that an error on the documentation?

I have executed the query in the logs on the SQL server and I've found the problem.

The query appears like this in the error message:
```
[SQL: SELECT DISTINCT TOP 100 runs.run_uuid AS runs_run_uuid, runs.name AS runs_name, runs.source_type AS runs_source_type, runs.source_name AS runs_source_name, runs.entry_point_name AS runs_entry_point_name, runs.user_id AS runs_user_id, runs.status AS runs_status, runs.start_time AS runs_start_time, runs.end_time AS runs_end_time, runs.source_version AS runs_source_version, runs.lifecycle_stage AS runs_lifecycle_stage, runs.artifact_uri AS runs_artifact_uri, runs.experiment_id AS runs_experiment_id, CASE WHEN (anon_1.is_nan IS 1) THEN ? WHEN (anon_1.value IS NULL) THEN ? ELSE ? END AS clause_1, anon_1.value AS anon_1_value 
FROM runs LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT latest_metrics.[key] AS [key], latest_metrics.value AS value, latest_metrics.timestamp AS timestamp, latest_metrics.step AS step, latest_metrics.is_nan AS is_nan, latest_metrics.run_uuid AS run_uuid 
FROM latest_metrics 
WHERE latest_metrics.[key] = ?) AS anon_1 ON runs.run_uuid = anon_1.run_uuid 
WHERE runs.experiment_id IN (?) AND runs.lifecycle_stage IN (?) ORDER BY clause_1, anon_1.value, runs.start_time DESC, runs.run_uuid]
[parameters: (1, 1, 0, 'auc', '4', 'active')]
```

Performing the replacements... 
```
SELECT DISTINCT TOP 100 runs.run_uuid AS runs_run_uuid, runs.name AS runs_name, runs.source_type AS runs_source_type, runs.source_name AS runs_source_name, runs.entry_point_name AS runs_entry_point_name, runs.user_id AS runs_user_id, runs.status AS runs_status, runs.start_time AS runs_start_time, runs.end_time AS runs_end_time, runs.source_version AS runs_source_version, runs.lifecycle_stage AS runs_lifecycle_stage, runs.artifact_uri AS runs_artifact_uri, runs.experiment_id AS runs_experiment_id, CASE WHEN (anon_1.is_nan IS 1) THEN 1 WHEN (anon_1.value IS NULL) THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS clause_1, anon_1.value AS anon_1_value 
FROM runs LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT latest_metrics.[key] AS [key], latest_metrics.value AS value, latest_metrics.timestamp AS timestamp, latest_metrics.step AS step, latest_metrics.is_nan AS is_nan, latest_metrics.run_uuid AS run_uuid 
FROM latest_metrics 
WHERE latest_metrics.[key] = 'auc') AS anon_1 ON runs.run_uuid = anon_1.run_uuid 
WHERE runs.experiment_id IN ('1') AND runs.lifecycle_stage IN ('active') ORDER BY clause_1, anon_1.value, runs.start_time DESC, runs.run_uuid
```

The problem comes from the statement `CASE WHEN (anon_1.is_nan IS 1) THEN ...` as you can see below.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6637618/79772410-5838ae80-8330-11ea-8e67-7be2a05e63ca.png)

By replacing `IS` to `=` in the statement (`CASE WHEN (anon_1.is_nan = 1) THEN ...`) the query runs normally.

### More information
Here is the table `latest_metrics` definition:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6637618/79773047-33910680-8331-11ea-8c85-e9b6f6c3bcd0.png)

```
CREATE TABLE [dbo].[latest_metrics](
	[key] [varchar](250) NOT NULL,
	[value] [float] NOT NULL,
	[timestamp] [bigint] NULL,
	[step] [bigint] NOT NULL,
	[is_nan] [bit] NOT NULL,
	[run_uuid] [varchar](32) NOT NULL,
 CONSTRAINT [latest_metric_pk] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED 
(
	[key] ASC,
	[run_uuid] ASC
)WITH (STATISTICS_NORECOMPUTE = OFF, IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ON [PRIMARY]
) ON [PRIMARY]
GO

ALTER TABLE [dbo].[latest_metrics]  WITH CHECK ADD FOREIGN KEY([run_uuid])
REFERENCES [dbo].[runs] ([run_uuid])
GO
```

@arjundc-db 
Could you please take a second look at this?
The bug is still active. @arjundc-db Can you reopen it, please?

I apologize (did not see @lopezco comments after I closed the issue), I am reopening and issue and will look into @lopezco suggestion. 
Thank you @tsabata
